intro: Anchusa undulata proles granatensis, commonly known as the Granada waveblue, is a perennial plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period, which extends from late spring to early autumn.
